content: It's been snowing all day. A good day to contribute.
I prefer to buy my turkeys in the store and just watch these. But, in a pinch we have a supply nearby.
So you are the one feeding the wild turkeys.
We've got someone around here who's doing that too. We often see the same turkeys cross the road in one spot to eat. (Why did the turkey cross the road? ....)
Clearly, the Turkey crossed the road to get to my house.

Actually, my Dad likes to feed the deer - but the Turkeys always seem to get in on the action. I like having the turkeys around, my Dad a little less so. According to him, they eat too much. :-)

I would argue that the deer are pretty good eaters as well. They just don't get to the food quite as fast.
It's funny how people pick sides. A lot of people try to keep squirrels from eating bird feed. But I like watching them defeat the "squirrel proof" feeders

I like watching my dad try to defeat the squirrels with homemade backyard inventions. I'm pretty sure his shifting contraptions have at various points involved an old toilet seat, tin cans, and a crazy carpet.
YouTube - Building the Perfect Squirrel Proof Bird Feeder
That's not my dad, to be clear.
I've seen this video before. It's brilliant.
Amazing video!! :grinning:
